name: Realism
description: A mid-19th-century art movement focused on depicting everyday life and society with a high degree of accuracy and without idealization.

name: Impressionism
description: A 19th-century art movement characterized by small, thin brush strokes, open composition, emphasis on accurate depiction of light, and ordinary subject matter.

name: Cubism
description: An early 20th-century avant-garde art movement that revolutionized European painting and sculpture with its abstracted forms and fragmented perspective.

name: Surrealism
description: A 20th-century art movement that sought to release the creative potential of the unconscious mind through dream-like, fantastical imagery.

name: Abstract Expressionism
description: A post-World War II art movement in American painting, developed in New York in the 1940s, characterized by gestural brush strokes and the impression of spontaneity.

name: Pop Art
description: An art movement that emerged in the mid-1950s in Britain and the late 1950s in the United States, drawing inspiration from popular and commercial culture.
